summary: This document is an FBI Public Affairs news briefing summary referencing a Palm Beach Post article from May 30. The article reports that the FBI released memos indicating convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein provided information to the FBI, which may explain his 2008 plea deal to state charges and avoidance of federal prosecution. The document also includes a brief, truncated reference to Sean Hannity commenting on Fox News.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the report; a convicted Palm Beach sex offender who allegedly provided information to the FBI, which is suggested as a reason for his 2008 plea deal to state charges and avoidance of federal prosecution.

persons.name: Sean Hannity
persons.context: Mentioned in a truncated sentence regarding comments made on his Fox News program 'Hannity' about an unrelated matter (Sessions' recusal).

events.title: Epstein's State Plea Deal
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges, a decision that made a federal investigation into allegations he paid dozens of teenage girls for sex 'disappear.'

events.title: FBI Memos Released
events.description: The FBI released heavily-redacted, decade-old memos on its website 'The Vault,' which contained a declaration that Epstein had provided information to the FBI as agreed.

keyFacts: The FBI released memos stating Jeffrey Epstein 'provided information to the FBI as agreed upon.'
This information is suggested as an explanation for Epstein's 2008 plea deal to state charges, which halted a federal investigation.
The released memos were heavily redacted and posted unexpectedly on the FBI's public website 'The Vault.'
The original allegations involved Epstein paying dozens of teenage girls for sex.
The plea deal has been widely described as a 'sweetheart deal' and part of a potential cover-up to protect Epstein's associates.
